thread.title: Cadets roll on, beat Groves 68-0
thread.title_full: Cadets roll on, beat Groves 68-0 | savannahnow.com

author: MIKE BROWN
title: Cadets roll on, beat Groves 68-0
text:
By MIKE BROWN
Groves coach Mike Martin had no illusions about the briar patch his team was about to jump into Friday night.
“We’re going to do the best we can,” Martin said prior to the kickoff of the Rebels’ Senior Night game with Benedictine at Garden City Stadium.
“I just want them to play hard and not quit.”
The Rebels played hard, and they didn’t quit, but it wasn’t enough against the unbeaten Cadets (8-0, 5-0) who rolled to their eighth straight win of the season and 15th consecutive dating back to last year with a 68-0 Region 2-AA win over the winless Rebels (0-8, 0-5).
Benedictine stunned Groves with a 34-point first quarter and added two touchdowns in the second quarter for a 48-0 halftime lead that mercifully resulted in a running clock in the second half.
It was a game of total domination on the part of the Cadets, who had 239 yards in the first half on 26 plays, 14 of which covered 10 more yards.
Quarterback Nick Iannone completed all six of his passing attempts for 78 yards and three touchdowns.
After Jacob Collins scored on a 9-yard run on the fourth play of the game, on the Cadets’ next three possessions Iannone threw a 10-yard scoring pass to Nick Whitfield, then teamed with Kalen Deloach on a 5-yard score, and next hit backup quarterback Michael Dernell on a 14-yard strike in the right corner of the end zone.
Dernell’s touchdown came with 3:35 left on the clock, and Wesley Kennedy completed the first quarter blitzkrieg when he ran 29 yards around the left side with 42 seconds showing on the clock.
Benedictine had 345 yards rushing on the night, 161 in the first half, with Kennedy gaining 70, and Tyleek Collins getting 55, all in the first quarter. Collins also returned two punts for 49 yards. Ten different Cadets had rushing attempts as coach Danny Britt pulled most of his starters by the middle of the second quarter.
Collins added a second touchdown when he scored on a 1-yard run, and sophomore Dennis Bailey added a 4-yard touchdown run with 2:15 left in the half.
While the Benedictine offense was moving the football at will, the defense also did its part to make life miserable for the Rebels as it came up with three interceptions and limited Groves to only 7 yards total offense, three on the ground, on 24 plays in the first half. Groves had 11 plays that resulted in negative yardage, and finished with 28 yards rushing, 26 by quarterback Tyrone Gadson.
“Our starters came out and did what they had to do,” Britt said. “I was worried about our focus, but once the game started we were fine.
“We were able to start working on our rotations in the second quarter, and we got to play a lot of people. There are still some things we need to work on, but we did a fine job.”
Benedictine got 4-yard scoring run in the third quarter from Shawn Campbell and added scores in the fourth on a 15-yard run with a fumble recovery by Mallie Seckinger and RaQuez Martin on a 20 yard run.
Groves 0 0 0 0 – 0
Benedictine 34 14 7 13 – 68
BC—Jacob Collins 9 run (kick failed)
BC— Nick Whitfield 10 pass from Nick Iannone (Jake Karesh kick)
BC— Kalen Deloach 5 pass from Iannone (Karesh kick)
BC— Michael Dernell 14 pass from Iannone (Karesh kick)
BC— Wesley Kennedy 29 run (Karesh kick)
BC— Collins 1 run (Karesh kick)
BC— Dennis Bailey 4 run (Karesh kick)
BC— Shawn Campbell 4 run (Powell Fisher kick)
BC— Mallie Seckinger 15 fumble return (Fisher kick)
BC— RaQuez Martin 20 run (kick failed)
